newsitem.title: CANADA: Gandalf blames product revenue for Q2 loss.
newsitem.headline: Gandalf blames product revenue for Q2 loss.

text.p: Gandalf Technolgies Inc reported a steep loss in its second quarter earnings on Wednesday.

The technology company said it lost C$8.7 million or C$0.20 per share on revenues of C$15.2 million in the second quarter compared to a small profit of C$35,000 on revenues of C$27.4 million a year ago.
The company blamed poor product revenues for the loss.
Gandalf said it experienced difficulties in implementing a new sales distribution model in the first half of the company's fiscal year.
"The situation is taking longer to correct than the company had originally anticipated," Gandalf said.
The company also saw revenues from its mature product lines fall, especially in Europe.
Products sheduled for shipping in the second quarter were on target, Gandalf said.
